questions.question_text: Which are required to create the schedule management plan?

choices.D: Activity list, project statement of work, project charter, and communications management plan
choices.B: Resource management plan, organizational process assets, activity list, and business case
choices.A: Scope baseline, work breakdown structure (WBS), estimated costs, and milestone list
choices.C: Enterprise environmental factors, organizational process assets, project charter, and project management plan

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
WBS is part of the Project Management Plan

comments.content: those outputs of the plan project mgt process

discussion.content: why isn't it A? you need the WBS to make the schedule

Selected Answer: C
C for sure
C - pg 571 6th Ed: Inputs: Project Charter, Project Management Plan, EEFs, and OPAs

I would have thought A since they all go into the the schedule management plan. I wouldn't think C is right because it includes the project management plan, which uses the schedule management plan as an input.
C is correct-6.1

choices.C: During each iteration as the project progresses
choices.B: During the Initiation and Planning phases
choices.A: Only during the Initiation and Closing phases
choices.D: Throughout the Planning process group and retrospective meeting

questions.question_text: In an agile or adaptive environment, when should risk be monitored and prioritized?

discussion.content: C-During each iteration as the project progresses-p.400

choices.D: Current emotional state, personality, and background
choices.A: Background, personality, and communications management plan

discussion.content: D - Communication Model for Cross-Cultural Communication pg. 373

Selected Answer: D
comm management plan is not a factor but a document

Selected Answer: D
Yes, it's D.

Selected Answer: D
D for sure

D- per pmbok 6th, 10.1.2.4 ( communication models) page 373. Cross cultural communication ( a tool/technique of Plan Communication Management) incorporates the idea that the message itself and how it is transmitted are influenced by the senders current emotional state, knowledge, background, personality, culture and biases. Similarly the receivers emotional state ,knowledge, background, personality, culture and biases will influence how the messages is is received and interpreted.

D - The communication model shown in Figure 10-4 incorporates the idea that the message itself and how it is transmitted are influenced by the sender’s current emotional state, knowledge, background, personality, culture, and
biases. Similarly, the receiver’s emotional state knowledge, background, personality, culture, and biases will influence how the message is received and interpreted, and will contribute to the barriers or noise

questions.question_text: Which factors should be considered for cross-cultural communication?

The procurement requirements for a project include working with several vendors. What should the project manager take into consideration during the Project
Procurement Management processes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The involvement of multiple vendors can significantly increase the complexity of procurement activities. Understanding and managing this complexity is crucial, encompassing aspects such as handling various contracts, ensuring coordination among vendors, managing different delivery schedules, and addressing potential conflicts or dependencies between vendors. The procurement management plan would also be crucial, but in this context, the complexity of managing multiple vendors is a significant consideration.

Selected Answer: C
C-several vendors lend to complexity of the process

Selected Answer: C
I think this should be C. It said to keep in mind when it comes to the Project Procurement Management Processes and specifically states there are multiple vendors. That adds to the complexity of procurement, which is C. I can see that D. would help you actually MANAGE it and in that management plan you'd develop that level of complexity, so it's confusing there. But I think is should be C. Can someone help me out with WHY it should be D. versus C.?

Selected Answer: D
D for sure
basis of work = plan

Selected Answer: C
Agree with C. It's in the book. Tailoring

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C:

from p 683 PMBOK 6th Ed. 

X5.9 PROJECT PROCUREMENT MANAGEMENT
Considerations for tailoring project procurement management include but are not limited to:
- Complexity of procurement. Is there one main procurement or are there multiple procurements at different times with different sellers that add to the complexity of the procurements?
D is correct due. Remember this process is iterative. When time to conduct procurement, the Procurement Management Plan is vital.

Selected Answer: D
WPI makes more sense in Control Procurements. The question is more general so Procurement Management Plan should cover all.

Selected Answer: A
It is D - Procurement Plan,. It is not Work performance information because this is managed in Control Process and not in Manage Process

comments.content: WPI makes more sense in Control Procurements. The question is more general so Procurement Management Plan should cover all.

discussion.content: A-Work Performance Information makes the most sene, to monitor how each vendor is performing-12.3.3.2

Selected Answer: A
The risk management plan outlines the strategy for managing risks throughout the project, including the approach to identifying, assessing, and responding to risks.
Key document here is the assumption log.
A-Risk Management Plan and Assumption Log

questions.question_text: A project receives budget approval, but the risk of extra costs is expected. Which of these inputs should the project manager check in order to make a qualitative risk analysis?

choices.A: The risk management plan and the assumption log
choices.C: The risk management plan and the basis of estimates
choices.D: The assumption log and the project charter
